channel.title: git on SeungJin YOUN
channel.description: Recent content in git on SeungJin YOUN

item.title: Ssh Add Issue for Git Push
item.description: Struggled with pushing Vim-fugitive. The main issue was happening whenever I tried to push on Vim-fugitive. Problem load Username failed fatal: could not read Username for 'https://github.com': No such device or address ssh-askpass error ssh_askpass: exec(/usr/bin/ssh-askpass): No such file or directory debian Cause The message meant that I wasn’t verified with my own SSH. Solution had to install ssh-add, through sudo apt-get install ssh-add. firstly made sure whether do I have the keygen existed by ls -al ~/.

item.title: How to Automatically Push Git Without Credential Input
item.description: The problem So, the problem was that I had to keep writing down my credential info for pushing onto git repo. Solution git config credential.helper store git push <repo> git config --global credential.helper "cache --timeout 7200" This setting will expire your cached credential info for 2 hours later. Conclusion git config credential.helper store commands order to store the git user info (pw, id) in local env - It can raise security issue.

item.title: Fork app subtree was the solution to upload specific folder
item.description: Git was super difficult for me. but it took the time to get used with, inevitably. The matter of fact is that I needed to upload public folder which is the projection for this hugo blog. When I just able to upload the publicfolder to the gh-pages only, during wrapping up all git changes, I was the only way to seperately manage the hugo blog well. the right way was subtree. The git’s subtree function
